name: places/ChIJAzrILwhZwokRbj8xZORgN9U
formattedAddress: 134 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 134 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016-8107, USA

originalText.text: Listen, I’m not picky when it comes to massages at all, but I had a disappointing experience at this massage parlor. They charged me $15 more than their advertised prices (very irritating), the space was messy and lacked privacy. Conversations between masseuses made me uncomfortable, and the overall atmosphere wasn't relaxing. The massage itself was subpar, with cold conditions, improper coverage, and excessive force using elbows and forearms. There was also uncomfortable proximity and excessive body contact. Definitely not worth the $74 I paid (I still tipped because they were staring at me) considering it was advertised as $50 on their website.

originalText.text: Wish I had read these reviews sooner- I just left and was feeling really sick to my stomach and flustered and called a friend saying I think I had been groped during my massage. I was so creeped out and was sure it wasn’t right but of course felt guilty to not tip someone in service industry and thought maybe I was exaggerating: definitely going for a full refund.if you’re female please don’t go here.

originalText.text: Truly the best massage place in NYC! Service is amazing and massages are magical! Jason is the best !

text.text: Truly the best massage place in NYC! Service is amazing and massages are magical! Jason is the best !

originalText.text: Came in today because I pulled my lower back over the weekend.  They did not disappoint.  They do intense deep tissue healing massages.  It’s not for those who want a “fluff” massage.  If you can’t handle pressure and pain from someone digging into your muscles go to a hotel and pay $200 for someone to spray some lavender water on you or log into YouTube and listen to some asmr for a tingle.  They are the real deal! I highly recommend especially if you are in need of real massage therapy.  Lovely family owned business and well priced.  I wish I went to them sooner. Unfortunately we are moving from the neighborhood but had I known all these years how great they were I would have gone once a week.  Go go go, they are a must for the neighborhood.

originalText.text: I gave you 5 stars in Google maps. here's what I wrote -They are experts in Chinese massage.  One of the best I have ever used.  The couple's English is bad, that's why their fees are the lowest.  Just tell them "tone" if they are massaging too hard. Say "How" if it feels good. they don't advertise, so have to depend on word-of-mouth of customers who recommend them to others. many athletes come here. I had my back and neck massaged.  They pointed out where my knots are.
